Description: Wall fragment with rim of Gnathia ring-handled pottery skyphos. Fine, light grey (10 YR 7/1), partly fired to pale brown to yellow (10 YR 8-7/6-4) clay. Glossy black coating. Exterior: on the rim white-yellow floral ornament; below, a horizontal groove and vertical ribbing.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
J.R.Green, "Gnathia Pottery in the Akademisches Kunstmuseum Bonn" (1976), pp.12 et seq., pp.22 et seq., no.24 fig.1 pl.21b.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 53, no. D30, pl. 25, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.014)
